title: Wallsend 'murder': Mum of baby stabbed to death 'longed for' a child, neighbours say
text:

A 21-year-old mum whose newborn son was stabbed to death at her home 'longed' for a child and excitedly prepared her home for the baby's arrival.

Andreea Stefan's dreams of motherhood were tragically crushed when little Little Andrei Stefan was fatally wounded at home at just three-weeks-old.

Her neighbours have revealed heartbreaking details of how the young woman was so excited to be a mum before the alleged attack, on October 2, snatched her boy from her.

A couple who live next door to the scene, at Portland Close, Wallsend, North Tyneside, told reporters Andreea "was always saying how much she was looking forwards to having the baby."

(Image: Facebook)

The 56-year-old male neighbour, who did not want to be named, told Chronicle Live : "She just seemed really excited."

And his wife explained how Andreea had told her she was expecting a boy.

The 57-year-old added: "She was talking to me a few days before she gave birth saying how excited she was and how she knew it was going to be a boy.

"She was really excited, they were getting stuff for the flat and getting everything ready.

"We couldn't believe it when we heard what had happened."

(Image: Daily Mirror)

The couple, who live in the flat below, were away on holiday in Scotland at the time.

But they quickly learned what was going on when they saw coverage of the incident online.

"It just all unfolded on Facebook ," said the man. "We didn't realise it was the flat upstairs at first. It was really strange seeing our front door on the news."

And when the couple discovered it was Andreea and her new baby who had been stabbed they were horrified.

The man said: "The young lassie Andreea was quite friendly. We would always say 'hi' in passing.

"We knew she had had the baby but we hadn't seen her with him. We talked to her mum a lot too, she's a really nice woman.

"We saw her the day before we went away and she was really chuffed about becoming a grandmother. It must be a big shock for all the family as well."

Little Andrei died in hospital four days after he was fatally wounded at his home.

Andreea was also seriously injured in the alleged attack, but has now been discharged from hospital.

Police were called to the flats at around 2.15pm and both Andreea and Andrei were taken to hospital with serious injuries.

Nothing could be done to save the baby's life and he died the following Sunday.

Since Andrei's death a makeshift shrine of flowers, cards and teddy bears have been left outside the front door of the flats.

A JustGiving page was also set-up to support Andreea, but has since been closed down.

(Image: chroniclelive.co.uk/)

The couple say they have not seen Andreea back at her home since the incident, but her mum has been into the flat briefly.

The woman said: "I wouldn't blame her if she didn't want to go back."

Neighbours said Andreea, who is originally from Romania, moved into the flat around Easter this year.

It is understood she bought the two bedroom property for £65,000.

Andrei's father, Denis Beytula, has appeared at Newcastle Crown Court charged with Andrei's murder and attempting to murder Andreea.

The 27-year-old, of Portland Close, is due back in court tomorrow for a pre-trial hearing.
description: Andreea Stefan's neighbours revealed heartbreaking details of how her dreams of motherhood were tragically snatched from her by the death of little Andrei on October 2
